FuncDef: The uninstall-module next-startup command clears the specified module that is automatically loaded during the next startup of the device. The uninstall-module next-startup command clears the specified module that is automatically loaded during the next startup of the device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a module file.
The value is a string of 5 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: This will uninstall the xxxxxx.MOD module. Are you sure? [Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo:
If a specified module does not need to be started next time, you can run the uninstall-module next-startup command to clear the specified module from the next startup module list.
If all modules do not need to be started next time, run the uninstall-module next-startup all command to clear all modules from the module list for next startup.
